Package io.github.jgame.mechanics

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jgame.sprite.Sprite
      • io.github.jgame.mechanics.Projectile
  • public class Projectile
extends Sprite
    Projectiles. Support for despawning, blitting, updates, blume, etc

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Vector2 blume
      The degree of random noice that would be added to the velocity every call to recalculate(boolean, boolean)
      long born
      When was the projectile "born"? The difference between this and the current time would be used to determine if the projectile should be despawned.
      long projectileLife
      For how many milliseconds would the projectile last before it despawns?
      private double speed
      Speed of the projectile.
      private Vector2 target  
      private Vector2 wobble
      The degree of random noise that should be added to the velocity every call to update()

        absPos, active, flipHorizontal, flipVertical, pos, rot, vel, visible

    • Field Detail

      • projectileLife

        public long projectileLife
        For how many milliseconds would the projectile last before it despawns?

      • born

        public long born
        When was the projectile "born"? The difference between this and the current time would be used to determine if the projectile should be despawned.

      • wobble

        private Vector2 wobble
        The degree of random noise that should be added to the velocity every call to update()

      • target

        private Vector2 target

      • speed

        private double speed
        Speed of the projectile.

      • blume

        private Vector2 blume
        The degree of random noice that would be added to the velocity every call to recalculate(boolean, boolean)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        public Projectile​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                  Vector2 target,
                  Vector2 position,
                  double speed,
                  long life,
                  Vector2 blume)
        Projectiles!
        Parameters:
        img - Image to blit for projectile
        target - Target position
        position - current position
        speed - Speed
        life - Life in milliseconds until projectile despawns
        blume - Max offset of initial velocity

    • Method Detail

      • setAttributes

        public void setAttributes​(Vector2 target,
                          Vector2 wobble,
                          double speed,
                          Vector2 blume)
        Set the attributes of the projectile. Call recalculate(boolean, boolean) to update the Velocity and rotation.
        Parameters:
        target - Target pos
        wobble - Wobble (added every frame)
        speed - speed
        blume - Blume (added on recalculate(boolean, boolean)

      • requestKill

        public void requestKill()
        Called when the Projectile needs to be killed, such as when it hits a wall. Override this function if the projectile could only be killed in certain conditions.

      • recalculate

        public void recalculate​(boolean rotation,
                        boolean velocity)
        Recalculate position and/or velocity. (NOTE: Blume would be added to the velocity. Use setAttributes(Vector2, Vector2, double, Vector2)) And set blume to Vector2[0, 0])
        Parameters:
        rotation - Should recalculate rot
        velocity - Should recalculate vel

      • accelerateTowards

        public void accelerateTowards​(Vector2 target,
                              double speed,
                              Vector2 blume)
        Accelerate towards the specified point. Negative speed will force it to accelerate in the opposite direction.
        Parameters:
        target - Target pos
        speed - speed (can be negative)
        blume - How accurately to accelerate towards the target. Vector2(0, 0) means 100% accuracy, while Vector2(1, 1) means the velocity is accurate up to 1 unit.

      • update

        public void update()
        Add the wobble to the velocity, and add the velocity to the position. Automatically despawns projectile after projectileLife milliseconds have passed since the constructor was called.
        Overrides:
        update in class Sprite

      • blit

        public void blit​(java.awt.Graphics2D screen)
        Draw to screen
        Overrides:
        blit in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        screen - Graphics to draw to.
